terrapeer.vui.j3dui.feedback
Class MultiShape

java.lang.Object
  javax.media.j3d.SceneGraphObject
      javax.media.j3d.Node
          javax.media.j3d.Group
              terrapeer.vui.j3dui.feedback.MultiShape
All Implemented Interfaces:
FeedbackTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
MultiAction, MultiSelect, MultiStatus, SecondBlocks.FloorTarget, SecondBlocks.Room
public class MultiShape
extends javax.media.j3d.Group
implements FeedbackTarget

Base class for switch-like groups implementing the "multishape" technique, where an object is represented as a set of discrete shapes associated with corresponding interactive feedback states.

None or more feedback event targets can be added as event targets with setEventTarget(). This conveniently allows a multishape to output its composite feedback state for feedback management and for chaining interaction control.

A multishape can serve as a proxy for both scenegraph and feedback grouping by adding a feedback target as an event target and its corresponding scenegraph target as a child node of this group.

Typically subclasses are capable of handling only one type of feedback: status, select, or action. Subclasses can be nested in any order by feedback type and to any depth but they must be controlled from the top-most multishape in a particular "cluster" since control propagates down the hierarchy, not up. A typical hierarchy, from top to bottom, is: MultiStatus, MultiSelect, MultiAction.

Constructor Detail

MultiShape

public MultiShape()
Constructs a MultiShape as an empty proxy for a target with both scenegraph and feedback qualities. Use addProxyTarget() to add targets.

MultiShape

public MultiShape(javax.media.j3d.Node nodeTarget,
                  FeedbackTarget eventTarget)
Constructs a MultiShape as a proxy target.

Parameters:
nodeTarget - Target added as a scene graph child node. Null if none.
eventTarget - Target added as a feedback event target. Null if none.

MultiShape

protected MultiShape(int stateCount)
Constructs a MultiShape with the specified number of states and configured for live access.

Parameters:
stateCount - Maximum number of feedback states that can be supported.

setFeedbackStatus

public void setFeedbackStatus(int status)
Sets the appearance of the object based on the specified status state and notifies any event targets. If no node is defined for the corresponding choice then the object will appear hidden.

Specified by:
setFeedbackStatus in interface FeedbackTarget
Parameters:
status - Status state (Feedback.STATUS_???).

setNode

protected int setNode(int index,
                      int state,
                      int flags,
                      int slot,
                      javax.media.j3d.Node node)
Tests the state flags for the specified state. If it is found the state map is updated with the switch slot and the switch slot is updated with the node. The return slot index should be chained to the input slot index.

Parameters:
index - State index.
state - State flag corresponding to index that is to be tested for in flags.
flags - State flags to be tested.
slot - Switch slot index. If <0 none has been assigned yet.
node - Node to be set when the switch slot is assigned.
Returns:
The switch slot assigned to the node. -1 if no slot was assigned.
